com.tooltwist.xdata
Class XD

java.lang.Object
  com.tooltwist.xdata.XD
All Implemented Interfaces:
XSelector
public class XD
extends Object
implements XSelector

This class provides a data-independent way of accessing data. Data may be loaded into the class in various formats, but then accessed with a single consistent API as provided by the XSelector interface. The XSelector interface provides iteration over a list of data items. In the case of this class there is only a single data hierarchy, which is treated as a list of one record (the top of the hierarchy). The XSelector methods can then be used to select data or further lists beneath this hierarchy.

Author:
philipcallender
See Also:
https://github.com/tooltwist/xdata}

recogniseType

public static String recogniseType(String string)
Try to recognize the data type of a String. This method will call (XSelectorPlugin.stringIsRecognised(String) for each string handling plugin, until one is found that recognizes the string.

Parameters:
string -
Returns:
A string identifying the type of data in string.

invalidateAllSelectorsExcept

public void invalidateAllSelectorsExcept(Object object)
                                  throws XDIncompatibleFormatException
Remove the definitions for all data formats except the one specified. This is called if the contents of a specific data type has been changed by direct communication with it's selector. Note: this method is normally only ever called by a selector.

Parameters:
type -
Throws:
XDIncompatibleFormatException

iterator

public Iterator<XSelector> iterator()
This data type does not provide a list of records, so the next() method only returns true once.

To iterate over elements within this object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Specified by:
iterator in interface XSelector
Returns:

size

public int size()
Return the number of records in this selection.

Actually, this will always return one. Iteration over this type is provided for consistency, but only accesses the top of the data hierarchy.

Specified by:
size in interface XSelector

first

public void first()
Return the index of the data element currently being iterated over.

Actually, this will always return zero (the first element). Iteration over this type is provided for consistency, but only accesses the top of the data hierarchy.

Specified by:
first in interface XSelector

currentName

public String currentName()
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Return the name of the field currently selected. For example, if you used select("/* /customer") to get this XDSelector object, then the field name will be "customer".

Specified by:
currentName in interface XSelector
Returns:

currentIndex

public int currentIndex()
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Return the index of the field currently selected. While iterating through a selection, this counts through the items in the selection, starting at zero.

select

public XSelector select(String xpath)
                 throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Select a list. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 XDSelector list = data.select("/* /product");
 while (list.next()) {
        String description = list.string("description");
 }

Specified by:
select in interface XSelector
Returns:
Throws:
XDException

foreach

public void foreach(String xpath,
                    Object userData,
                    XDCallback callback)
             throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 MyData myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
     MyData myData = (MyData) data;
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

Specified by:
foreach in interface XSelector
Throws:
XDException

 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

foreach

public Iterable<XSelector> foreach(String xpath)
                            throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through items using Iterable notation. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 for (IXData item : data.foreach("/* /product")) {
        String description = item.string("description");
 }
